column6: Bill is looking forward to going on his summer holidays, as he has been working hard for months.
column7: Then, Bill packs his passport in his suitcase for the journey.
column8: Bill's luggage is delayed but eventually arrives, and he has a terrible time on his holidays.

column6: John comes home early from work because himself and his wife are having a dinner party that evening.
column7: After arriving home, he takes off his coat and goes to his wife in the kitchen.
column8: John finds the peeler and starts to prepare the potatoes for dinner, and his wife says he has made a mess of it.

column6: Rebecca is at the beach and wants to go for a swim in the sea.
column7: Rebecca then puts on her goggles and walks toward the sea.
column8: The lifeguard tells Rebecca the sea is unsafe to swim and there is bad weather today.

column6: Sally wants to buy a bottle of wine for her Friday evening dinner.
column7: Sally decides to go to the corner-shop near her house.
column8: The shop is shut and Sally has an argument with a neighbour walking home.

column6: Belinda is on a plane going to Los Angeles for a business meeting.
column7: When Belinda reaches Los Angeles, she takes a taxi downtown to the meeting venue.
column8: Belinda's taxi takes her to the wrong office block, but she is content because she is early.

column6: Lucy hates her old car and wants to buy a new one.
column7: Lucy calls the bank to get a loan for a new car.
column8: The car dealer says her old car is a wreck and worth nothing, but she is happy to sell it for practical reasons.

column6: After waking up, Michael goes downstairs to have his breakfast.
column7: Then, Michael goes into the kitchen and makes some tea.
column8: Michael found the tea bags to put in the pot and was reminded of the happy days when he was studying at university.

column6: Sean is in a foreign country and wants to contact his mother to let her know he is safe.
column7: Sean takes out his mobile phone and dials her number.
column8: The network has a strong signal and Sean is looking forward to talking to his mother.
